==Death==
==Death==
[[File:Ali Jawad al-Sheikh dead.jpg|thumb|A picture of Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's corpse.]]
[[File:Ali Jawad al-Sheikh dead.jpg|thumb|A picture of Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's corpse.]]
â
A number of protesters, including Isa Hassan, Ali's uncle, took part in a demonstration in [[Sitra]], [[Bahrain]] on 31 August just after [[Fajr|morning prayers]]. They stated that they were "confronted by the police, and did not cause Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's death". In an interview with the ''[[Associated Press]]'', Isa explained that "they lob the canisters of gas and do not shoot them at people. Police don't use it as a weapon."<ref name="NYT">{{cite news |title=A 14-Year-Old Boy Is Killed in Bahrain as Security Forces Break Up a Protest |author=J. David Goodman |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/01/world/middleeast/01bahrain.html?_r=2 |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Shiite teenager killed in Bahrain demo: opposition |author= |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hNosFeJn1CDW-5tkxxaV7gkw63sg?docId=CNG.ee159abe0e0b3f7c4e870162182b6233.3a1 |newspaper=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Bahraini boy killed in protest |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/08/2011831132740548678.html?utm_content=automateplus&utm_campaign=Trial5&utm_source=SocialFlow&utm_term=tweets&utm_medium=MasterAccount |newspaper=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref>
+
A number of protesters, including Isa Hassan, Ali's uncle, took part in a demonstration in [[Sitra]], [[Bahrain]] on 31 August just after [[Fajr|morning prayers]]. They stated that they were "confronted by the police, and did not cause Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's death". In an interview with the ''[[Associated Press]]'', Isa explained that "they are supposed to lob the canisters of gas, not shoot them at people. Police used it as a weapon."<ref name="NYT">{{cite news |title=A 14-Year-Old Boy Is Killed in Bahrain as Security Forces Break Up a Protest |author=J. David Goodman |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/01/world/middleeast/01bahrain.html?_r=2 |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Shiite teenager killed in Bahrain demo: opposition |author= |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hNosFeJn1CDW-5tkxxaV7gkw63sg?docId=CNG.ee159abe0e0b3f7c4e870162182b6233.3a1 |newspaper=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Bahraini boy killed in protest |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/08/2011831132740548678.html?utm_content=automateplus&utm_campaign=Trial5&utm_source=SocialFlow&utm_term=tweets&utm_medium=MasterAccount |newspaper=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref>
After his death, Ali's body was removed from the hospital and moved to the morgue, where an [[autopsy]] was carried out.<ref name="CNN"/> In the afternoon, Osama al-Asfoor, the [[Director of Public Prosecutions|head of public prosecution]], stated that the autopsy had shown that "Ali had died of injuries to the back of his neck" and that "the boy had injuries under his chin and bruises on his face, hand, knees and pelvic area." However, he also added that a "blood examination showed no effects of tear gas exposure."<ref name="NYT"/>
After his death, Ali's body was removed from the hospital and moved to the morgue, where an [[autopsy]] was carried out.<ref name="CNN"/> In the afternoon, Osama al-Asfoor, the [[Director of Public Prosecutions|head of public prosecution]], stated that the autopsy had shown that "Ali had died of injuries to the back of his neck" and that "the boy had injuries under his chin and bruises on his face, hand, knees and pelvic area." However, he also added that a "blood examination showed no effects of tear gas exposure."<ref name="NYT"/>
